output_data.clarification_question: What was the total session time (start to finish, including counseling and medication management)? Time documentation is required to select the appropriate CPT code for psychotherapy and/or E/M services.

primary_code.description: Established patient office or other outpatient visit, typically 30 minutes spent face-to-face or complex Medical Decision Making (MDM).
primary_code.rationale: The session involved complex medical decision-making: monitoring an established SSRI (*Sertraline*), assessing treatment failure after 4 weeks, performing a detailed C-SSRS equivalent risk assessment (confirming passive SI), and escalating the medication dose. This level of complexity supports a Level 4 E/M code, independent of time, though time is still needed for the psychotherapy component.

addon_codes.description: Psychotherapy add-on, 53+ minutes (to be confirmed by time documentation).
addon_codes.rationale: The provider spent significant time discussing specific symptoms (early morning awakening, guilt, loss of purpose) and exploring the passive suicidal ideation. This clinical engagement qualifies as psychotherapy provided concurrently with the E/M service. The exact duration (and thus the necessary minimum time threshold, 30m, 45m, or 53m) is pending confirmation.

output_data.medical_necessity: Recurrent Major Depressive Disorder, Moderate (F33.1). The patient presented with significant impairment (missing work), vegetative symptoms (anhedonia, weight loss), and passive suicidal ideation, requiring intensive medication adjustment and comprehensive safety planning/psychotherapy.
